How To Use

1

Select Your Device Type

Choose whether you have an iPhone or Android device for tailored instructions.

Choose the carrier your phone is currently locked to (AT&T, Verizon, T-Mobile, etc.).

3

Review Requirements

See the specific requirements your carrier needs before they'll unlock your phone.

4

Follow the Steps

Use our step-by-step guide and official carrier links to complete the unlock process.

Why This Matters

Why You Need an Unlocked Phone

Most phones purchased through a carrier are 'locked' to that carrier's network. To use your phone with Vouch Mobile, it must be unlocked. The good news: carriers are legally required to unlock eligible phones, and the process is usually free. Understanding your carrier's requirements saves time and frustration.

  • Carrier-locked phones can only be used on that carrier's network
  • Unlocking is free and required by FCC regulations for eligible devices
  • Most carriers require 60 days of active service before unlocking
  • Phones must be paid off in full before carriers will unlock them

FAQ

Frequently Asked Questions

Common questions about the Unlock Guide

The easiest test is to insert a SIM card from a different carrier. If it works, your phone is unlocked. You can also check in your phone settings or contact your carrier directly.

Most carriers process unlock requests within 24-48 hours. AT&T and Verizon are typically fastest, while some prepaid carriers may take up to 5 business days.

No, unlocking your phone does not affect your data, apps, or settings. It simply removes the carrier restriction so you can use other networks.

If you meet all requirements and your carrier refuses, you can file a complaint with the FCC. Carriers are legally required to unlock eligible devices. Common issues include outstanding balances or not meeting the time requirement.

Yes, your carrier will need your IMEI number when you submit an unlock request. You can find it by dialing *#06# on your phone or checking Settings > About Phone.
